class vikidm.libs.handler.Versioned[source]¶

Decorator for different api version.

Examples:

from viki_qa.libs.handler import Versioned

@Versioned.get(‘1.0’) def get_v1(...):

print ‘GET method if version >= v1.0’

@Versioned.post(‘1.0’) def post_func(...):

print ‘POST method if version >= v1.0’

vikidm.libs.route module¶

Decorator for a tornado.web.RequestHandler configuring the route and initialization dict.

The Route decorator stores all routes inside a class level list. You can then add all routes to the application using the Route.routes method. Some examples:

from tornadotools.route import Route

@Route(r"/")
class SimpleHandler(RequestHandler):
    pass

@Route(r"/test_with_name", name="test")
class SimpleHandler2(RequestHandler):
    pass

@Route(r"/test_with_init", initialize={'init': 'dictionary'})
class SimpleHandler3(RequestHandler):
    pass

app = Application([
    # other routes
    ] + Route.routes()
)

Tornado also support multiple hosts. When you want to use this with the Route decorator, you have to create the tornado.web.Application like this:

from tornadotools.route import Route

@Route(r"/.*", host="www\.example\.com")
class HostHandler(RequestHandler):
    pass

app = Application([])
Route.routes(app)
class vikidm.libs.route.Route(route, initialize={}, name=None, host='.*$')[source]¶

The Route decorator.

Methods

__call__(handler) Called when we decorate a class.
routes([application]) Method for adding the routes to the tornado.web.Application.
classmethod routes(application=None)[source]¶

Method for adding the routes to the tornado.web.Application.
